register.description: IP Revision Identifier (X.Y.R) Used by software to track features, bugs, and compatibility.

bitfield.description: Revision ID

register.description: Information about the IP module's hardware configuration, i.e. typically the module's HDL generics.

bitfield.description: Logical channels
Maximum outstanding OCP transactions
Configuration of the local initiator state management mode. By definition, initiator may generate read/write transaction as long as it is out of STANDBY state.

bitenum.description: Force-standby mode: local initiator is unconditionally placed in standby state. Backup mode, for debug only.
No-standby mode: local initiator is unconditionally placed out of standby state. Backup mode, for debug only.

bitfield.description: SIMCOP DMA guarantees that there are at least BW_LIMITER functional clock cycles between two OCP requests. No IDLE cycles are inserted during an OCP transaction. This parameter could be used to reduce traffic generated by the SIMCOP DMA for non timing critical applications. Doing so leaves more BW for other system initiators. Default value corresponds to maximum performance.
Limits the outstanding transactions count. Only tags 0 - TAG_CNT will be used by SIMCOP DMA The maximum allowed value is 2
Select write type. Setting depend on the used interconnect

bitenum.description: Only non posted writes are generated

bitfield.description: Defines the maximum burst length for INCR bursts. In case of 2D bursts, length x height is less or equal to this value.

register.description: Per-event raw interrupt status vector Raw status is set even if event is not enabled. Write 1 to set the (raw) status, mostly for debug.

DMA logical channel HW synchronization. Controls generation of the DONE pulse for the logical channel Only the values listed below are allowed. Other values lead to undefined behavior.
DMA logical channel HW synchronization. Controls sensitivity of the logical channel on a START pulse Only the values listed below are allowed. Other values lead to undefined behavior.
DMA logical channel linking. Only the values listed below are allowed. Other values lead to undefined behavior.

bitenum.description: Start channel 0 when this channel has completed transfer of one 2D block
Start channel 1 when this channel has completed transfer of one 2D block
Start channel 2 when this channel has completed transfer of one 2D block

Start channel 4 when this channel has completed transfer of one 2D block
Start channel 5 when this channel has completed transfer of one 2D block
Start channel 6 when this channel has completed transfer of one 2D block
Start channel 7 when this channel has completed transfer of one 2D block

bitfield.description: Selects OCP transaction breakdown algorithm

bitenum.description: Regular mode. INCR burst are used. ADDR[32]=0 for OCP transactions
Tiler mode. BLCK burst are used. ADDR[32]=1 for OCP transactions

bitfield.description: Transfer direction
SW could poll this bit to know the state of the channel
Software trigger of the DMA channel. Read of this register always returns 0.

bitenum.description: Change the logical channel state to PENDING if it is in ACTIVE state. No effect if the channel is in RUNNING, PENDING or IDLE state

bitfield.description: Disable control of the logical channel. Read of this register always returns 0.

bitenum.description: Disable the channel. Changes the logical channel state to IDLE when it is in ACTIVE state. Memorize a disable request when the channel is in RUNNING or PENDING state.

bitfield.description: Enable control of the logical channel. Read of this register always returns 0.

bitenum.description: Enable the channel. Changes the state of the logical channel from IDLE to ACTIVE.

bitfield.description: DMA logical channel HW synchronization. Controls generation of the DONE pulse for the logical channel Only the values listed below are allowed. Other values lead to undefined behavior.
DMA logical channel HW synchronization. Controls sensitivity of the logical channel on a START pulse Only the values listed below are allowed. Other values lead to undefined behavior.
DMA logical channel linking. Only the values listed below are allowed. Other values lead to undefined behavior.

bitenum.description: Start channel 0 when this channel has completed transfer of one 2D block

register.description: SW could read the coordinates of the last transferred block. The status is reset when the channel is enabled (change the state of CTRL.ENABLE from 0 to 1).

bitfield.description: Vertical position of the last transferred 2D block in the frame.
Horizontal position of the last transferred 2D block in the frame.

register.description: SW could read the coordinates of the last transferred block. The status is reset when the channel is enabled (change the state of CTRL.ENABLE from 0 to 1).

bitfield.description: Vertical position of the last transferred 2D block in the frame.

bitfield.description: Vertical position of the last transferred 2D block in the frame.
Horizontal position of the last transferred 2D block in the frame.
Vertical offset, in lines, between rows of 2D blocks. For contiguous 2D blocks YSTEP=YNUM Valid values are -8192 to +8191.
Horizontal offset, in 128-bit words, between 2D block columns. For contiguous 2D blocks XSTEP=XNUM Valid values are -1024 to +1023, that corresponds to 16 bytes to 16kBytes.
Vertical offset, in lines, between rows of 2D blocks. For contiguous 2D blocks YSTEP=YNUM Valid values are -8192 to +8191.
